page.title: 20FLORA AND FAUNA
page.content: A study of the{ecology}of the area brings to light a variety of natural {vegetation.}Most of the high moors are covered with purple moor grass and mat grass with cotton sedge in the wetter areas on peaty ground. Heather and bilberry grow on well_drained, often rocky slopes and bracken is formed in large patches on the lower slopes of the hills where the soil is better. There is mixed,deciduous {woodland}at Hill Top and some tree planting has been done on the Rivington side of Winter Hill. Among the{birds} to be found in the area are the mountain linnet, kestrel,red grouse,short_eared owl and grey wagtail.Visiting water birds are also found on Belmont reservoir. Weasels, foxes and grey squirrels are among the local wild animals.
